_header: I have labored sore and suffered death

NLS19111.Transcription:
I haue laborede sore and suffered deyȝthand now I Rest and draw
                    my [b]reyghtBut I schall com and call Ryght soneheuen and erthe and
                    hell to domeand than schall know both devyll and manwhat I was and
                    what I am
NLS19111.Note:
Added to original blank flyleaf, with pentrials and drawings of cats,
                    including ‘barbars of brehelsay’.
NLS19111.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 177.
Oliver,  Raymond.

         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 36.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 222.
Pearsall,  Derek,
                        ed.  
             Chaucer to Spenser: An Anthology of Writings in English
                1375-1575.
         Oxford and Malden, MA: Blackwell, 1999: 394.
